bug.summary: RDATE and EXDATE properties malfunction when using a time zone instead of UTC.
DURATION data types misbehave when parsing an iCalendar.
bug.details: DURATION data types currently accept "full" durations, with day and time components, but reject a duration with only the day component (i.e. "-P2D"). Also, DURATION data types are not automatically assigned when parsing a content line.

bug.summary: Alarms will not trigger relative to the END of a component
bug.details: Alarms are currently only able to trigger relative to the START date of a component, whereas it should be able to trigger relative to the START or END of the component.

bug.summary: Calendar properties cannot have user-defined parameters
bug.details: Calendar properties, such as PRODID, VERSION, CALSCALE, and METHOD, do not allow custom parameters to be used. For example, PRODID;RELEASE=BETA:1.2

bug.summary: Calendar components do not directly have parameters associated with them
bug.details: Calendar components, such as Event components, Todo components, etc. cannot have parameters directly associated with them. The parameters are associated to the component via a ContentLine object, which is only populated when reading an iCalendar file; however, if generating an iCalendar from scratch, ContentLine objects are generally unused.

bug.summary: A value-type is always specified for certain fields when serializing.
bug.details: When certain fields are serialized, a VALUE parameter is always specified; however, most of these fields have a default value-type. If the value is already of the default value-type, a VALUE parameter should not be specified.

bug.summary: When saving data to an .ics file, lines are not "folded" at 75 characters
bug.details: As per RFC 2445, lines that exceed 75 characters in length should be "folded" by adding a line feed followed by a whitespace character.

bug.summary: Non-standard properties (X-properties) are not saved
bug.details: When loading an iCalendar with non-standard properties, such as Apple iCal's "X-WR-" properties (X-WR-CALNAME, X-WR-TIMEZONE, etc.), they are discarded. Hence, when serializing, those properties are never re-serialized.

bug.summary: Special characters, such as 'รง' and other international characters are not parsed correctly.
bug.details: Some international characters, such as 'รง' do not parse correctly. The parsing engine does not allow these types of characters to be in Text fields.

bug.summary: Failure to assign a Duration to an Event will cause the Evaluate() method to crash with an ArgumentOutOfRangeException
bug.details: Events do not (currently) automatically assign a Duration to an Event when you assign both a start and end time. The Duration must be assigned manually for the Evaluate() method to operate properly.

bug.summary: Unique component lists (Events, Todos, Journals, UniqueComponents) do not properly index components by UID.
bug.details: Unique component lists store UIDs in a dictionary upon creation; however, UIDs are usually set after the the unique component is created. When the UID is properly loaded, the Dictionary the references this UID is not updated as well.

bug.summary: EvalEnd and EvalStart are serialized with iCalendars, but they should not be.
Recurring components are not correctly limited by a certain number of instances.
bug.details: The COUNT property of iCalendars does not always correctly limit the number of instances when evaluated.

bug.summary: Empty iCalendars are not parsed correctly and cause the parser to hang.
iCalendars with missing parts (i.e. properties, components, etc.) are not parsed correctly and cause the parser to hang.
Recurring events, todos, and journals still don't always correctly limit the number of recurrences when using the COUNT property.
bug.details: When the recurring item is evaluated, and the list of recurrences doesn't include the original date/time of the event/todo/journal, the COUNT property doesn't work correctly. To solve this problem, a StaticOccurrences list must be provided to each Recur object to allow a component to declare its original occurence date/time. This way, the COUNT should always work as intended.

bug.summary: Time zone information is changed when finding information for a specific time zone.
bug.details: Calling GetTimeZoneInfo() causes the DTStart property of the time zone to change.

bug.summary: Some recurrence rules do not correctly ignore whitespace, causing the program to throw an exception.
Recurrence rules that restrict to a certain COUNT do not correctly filter by unique occurrences.
With certain events, event occurences are evaluated twice. This is due to a differentiation between UTC and Local time (i.e. DateTimeKind.Local and DateTimeKind.UTC).
